Good plan. Then we can get back to discussing important issues, like whethe=
r we should test ALL accessor methods! :-)

But seriously ... while the FAQ=
 is being updated, can we get the accessor method issue addressed the same =
way in the FAQ? Something along the lines of "test or don't test the access=
or methods, it's your choice!" :-) Some of us like to do that and some of u=
s don't, both view points are valid and both should be accepted/respected. =
But it might be good to have that explained really well in the FAQ to help =
the signal/noise ratio. (That being said, the signal/noise ratio around her=
e is far in favour of signal! :-)

Simon
